colasso 0.0.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Logistic regression with a continuous response

Source: R/bilasso.R
bilasso.Rd

Implements logistic regression with a continuous response.

bilasso(y, cutoff, X, alpha = 1, nfolds = 10, foldid = NULL,
  type.measure = "deviance", nsigma = 100, sigma = NULL,
  logistic = TRUE)

Arguments

y

continuous response: vector of length \(n\)
cutoff

cutoff point for dichotomising response into classes: value between min(y) and max(y)
X

covariates: numeric matrix with \(n\) rows (samples) and \(p\) columns (variables)
alpha

elastic net parameter: numeric between \(0\) (ridge) and \(1\) (lasso)
nfolds

number of folds
foldid

fold identifiers: vector with entries between \(1\) and nfolds; or NULL (balance)
type.measure

loss function for binary classification (linear regression uses the deviance)
nsigma

number of sigma values
sigma

sigma sequence: vector of increasing positive values; or NULL (default sequence)
logistic

fit logistic regression for comparison: logical (currently all methods require TRUE)

Details

INCLUDE note on deviance (not comparable between lin and log models)

Examples

n <- 100; p <- 200
y <- rnorm(n)
X <- matrix(rnorm(n*p),nrow=n,ncol=p)
bilasso(y=y,cutoff=0,X=X)
#> $gaussian
#>
